xxl.core.indexStructures
Class AutoDeleteMVBTree.NotifyHeap<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.queues.AbstractQueue<E>
      xxl.core.collections.queues.Heap<E>
          xxl.core.collections.queues.DynamicHeap<E>
              xxl.core.indexStructures.AutoDeleteMVBTree.NotifyHeap<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements of this heap.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Queue<E>
Enclosing class:
AutoDeleteMVBTree
protected static class AutoDeleteMVBTree.NotifyHeap<E>
extends DynamicHeap<E>

This class extends the DynamicHeap by providing a mechanism to notify a listener whenever an object in the heap changes its position.

This can be used to inform each object about its current position in the heap. Whenever an object's state changes in a way that affects the ordering in the heap, that object can then call the heap's update method, providing it's current position as the parameter, to restore the heap structure.

Method Detail

bubbleUp

protected void bubbleUp(E object,
                        int i)
Description copied from class: Heap
Inserts the specified object into the heap and overwrites the element at the index i of the internally used array without damaging the structure of the heap. The specified object is inserted into the path from the root of the heap to the element with the index i and the whole path beyond the inserted element is shifted one level down. This method only works fine when the following prerequisites are valid
  • 0 ≤ i ≤ last
  • comparator.compare(array[0], object) ≤ 0

Overrides:
bubbleUp in class Heap<E>
Parameters:
object - the object to insert into the heap.
i - an index of the internally used array. The specified object is inserted into the path from the root of the heap to the element with the index i.

sinkIn

protected int sinkIn(int i)
Description copied from class: Heap
Removes the element at the index i/2 of the internally used array without damaging the structure of the heap. The whole path from the element at the index i of the internally used array to the bottom level of the heap is shifted one level up. This method only works fine when the following prerequisite is valid
  • 1 ≤ i ≤ last

Overrides:
sinkIn in class Heap<E>
Parameters:
i - an index of the internally used array. The object at the index i/2 of the internally used array is removed.
Returns:
the index of the last element in the path that is shifted one level up.

Description copied from class: DynamicHeap
Returns the next element in the heap and removes it. The next element of the heap is determined by the comparator.

replace

public E replace(E object)
          throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Description copied from class: Heap
Replaces the next element in the heap with the specified object and restore the structure of the heap if necessary. More exactly, the specified object is inserted into the heap and the next element of the heap is overwritten. Thereafter the structure of the heap is restored and the overwritten element is returned. This method only works fine when the following prerequisite is valid
  • comparator.compare(array[0], object) ≤ 0

Overrides:
replace in class Heap<E>
Parameters:
object - element to be inserted into this heap.
Returns:
the next element in the heap.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - queue has no more elements.

update

protected void update(int index)
Description copied from class: Heap
If an object is updated at position index, the heap condition may be violated. This methode bubbles up the updated element or lets it sink down, until the condition is satisfied.

Overrides:
update in class Heap<E>
Parameters:
index - The index inside the array where an update occured.

Removes the element at the given position in the heap and returns it.

Parameters:

Returns:
the removed element
